passwordValidation.title: Password Validation
passwordValidation.description: If enabled, a set of password requirements will show on the account creation page, such as minimum length, uppercase/lowercase characters, etc.

email.useEmailAsUsernameNotice: If enabled, new users will login to Jellyfin/Emby with their email address instead of a username.
email.title: Email
email.description: jfa-go can send password reset PINs and various notifications through email. You can connect to an SMTP server, or use the {n} API.
email.dateFormatNotice: Date follows the strftime format. For more info, visit {n}.

passwordResets.resetLinks: Send a link instead of a PIN
passwordResets.resetLinksNotice: If Ombi integration is enabled, use this to sync Jellyfin password resets with Ombi.
passwordResets.title: Password Resets
passwordResets.description: When a user tries to reset their password, Jellyfin creates a file named 'passwordreset-*.json' which contains a PIN. jfa-go reads the file and sends the PIN to the user.
passwordResets.pathToJellyfinNotice: If you don't know where this is, try resetting your password in Jellyfin. A popup with '<path to jellyfin>/passwordreset-*.json' will appear.
passwordResets.setPasswordNotice: Enabling this means the user doesn't have to change their password from the PIN after the reset. Password validation will also be enforced.

helpMessages.title: Help Messages
helpMessages.description: These messages will display in the account creation page and in some emails.
helpMessages.contactMessageNotice: Displays at the bottom of all pages except admin.
helpMessages.helpMessageNotice: Displays on the account creation page.
helpMessages.successMessageNotice: Displays when a user creates their account.
helpMessages.emailMessageNotice: Displays at the bottom of emails.

strings.errorNotAdmin: User is not allowed to manage server.

startPage.httpsNotice: Make sure you're accessing this page via HTTPS or on a private network.
startPage.pressStart: You'll need to do a few things to set up jfa-go. Press start to continue.

jellyfinEmby.title: Jellyfin/Emby
jellyfinEmby.embyNotice: Emby support is limited and does not support password resets.
jellyfinEmby.description: An admin account is needed because the API does not allow user creation using an API key. You should create a separate account and check 'Allow this user to manage the server'. You can disable everything else. Once done, enter the login details here.
jellyfinEmby.replaceJellyfinNotice: If given, this will replace any occurrence of 'Jellyfin' in the app.
jellyfinEmby.addressExternalNotice: Leave blank to use the same address.

endPage.restartMessage: You can configure Discord/Telegram/Matrix bots, customise your messages and more in Settings. Click below to restart, then refresh the page.

language.title: Language
language.description: Community translations are available for most parts of jfa-go. You can choose the default languages below, but users can still change it if they wish. If you want to help translate, sign up to {n} to start contributing!

general.title: General
general.urlBaseNotice: Only needed if using a reverse proxy on a subdomain (e.g 'jellyf.in/accounts').
general.useHTTPSNotice: Only recommended if you aren't using a reverse proxy.

updates.title: Updates
updates.description: Enable to be notified when new updates are available. jfa-go will check {n} every 30 minutes. No IPs or personally identifiable information are collected.

login.title: Login
login.description: To access the admin page, you need to login with a method below:
login.authorizeManual: Username and Password: Manually set the username and password.
login.authorizeWithJellyfin: Authorise with Jellyfin/Emby: Login details are shared with Jellyfin, which allows for multiple users.
login.allowAll: Allow all Jellyfin users to login
login.allowAllDescription: Not recommended, you should allow individual users to login once setup.
login.emailNotice: Your email address can be used to receive notifications.

welcomeEmails.title: Welcome messages
welcomeEmails.description: If enabled, a message will be sent to new users with the Jellyfin/Emby URL and their username.

ombi.title: Ombi
ombi.description: By connecting to Ombi, both a Jellyfin and Ombi account will be created when a user joins through jfa-go. After setup is finished, go to Settings to set a default profile for new ombi users.
ombi.apiKeyNotice: Find this in the first tab of Ombi settings.

messages.description: jfa-go can send password resets and various messages through Email, Discord, Telegram, and/or Matrix. You can set up email below, and the others can be configured in Settings later. Instructions can be found on the {n}. If you don't need this, you can disable these features here.
messages.title: Messages

notifications.title: Admin Notifications
notifications.description: If enabled, you can choose (per invite) to receive an message when an invite expires, or a user is created. If you didn't choose the Jellyfin login method, make sure you provided your email address, or add another contact method later.

inviteEmails.title: Invite Messages
inviteEmails.description: If enabled, you can send invites directly to a user's email address, Discord or Matrix user. Because you might be using a reverse proxy, you need to provide the URL invites are accessed from. Write your URL Base, and append '/invite'.
